Proteus documentation can be created from docstrings using Sphinx. Sphinx is not present in the requirements text file so it has to be installed using the command `pip install Sphinx`.
Once Sphinx is installed, create a folder named docs (name ignored by `gitignore`).Inside the folder run the command `sphinx-quickstart` in order to create Sphinx files.
Modify the following files to ensure every docstring is documented.
In the file `index.rst` include the following lines at the end of the file: ``` .. autosummary:: :toctree: _autosummary :caption: PROTEUS packages and modules :recursive:
proteus ```
In the file `conf.py` include/replace the following lines: ``` python import sys import os sys.path.insert(0, os.path.abspath('..'))
extensions = [ 'sphinx.ext.duration', 'sphinx.ext.doctest', 'sphinx.ext.autodoc', 'sphinx.ext.autosummary', ]
autoclass_content = 'both' autodoc_default_options = { 'members': True, 'member-order': 'bysource', 'special-members': '__init__', } autosummary_generate = True ```
Once these files are modified, simple documentation can be generated using the make files provided by Sphinx quickstart command, `make.bat html` or `make html` depending on the OS.
For more advanced customization check Sphinx documentation.
